intro: Cyphostemma gilletii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Cyphostemma gilletii is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
